snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, who said he had begun participating directly in the talks Wednesday, called the Long Island Rail Road deal “a compromise by both parties” after a four-year dispute.
abstract: Long Island Rail Road and its unions reach agreement over dispute about pay and benefits three days before a planned walkout; sides complete deal in part with help from 11th-hour intervention by New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo.

byline.contributor: Joseph Berger, Steven Greenhouse and Tatiana Schlossberg contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, who said he had begun participating directly in the talks Wednesday, called the Long Island Rail Road deal “a compromise by both parties” after a four-year dispute.

headline.main: L.I.R.R. Strike Is Averted After Cuomo Intervenes in Labor Talks
headline.print_headline: Governor Brokers Deal to Avert Strike on Long Island Rail Road
